greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Second base-n Wieferich prime, i.e., second smallest prime p such that n^(p-1) == 1 (mod p^2).
comment: Column 2 of table T(n, k) of k-th base-n Wieferich prime for n > 1 (that table is not yet in the OEIS as a sequence).
a(11) is unknown, but must be larger than 1.202*10^13 if it exists (cf. Fischer).
example: a(3) = 1006003, because 1006003 is the second smallest prime p satisfying 3^(p-1) == 1 (mod p^2) (see A014127).
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(i=0); forprime(p=1, , if(Mod(n, p^2)^(p-1)==1, if(i > 0, return(p), i++)))
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Feb 02 2016
